{"step_by_step_thinking": "Obesity is a known risk factor for vascular abnormalities. The carotid artery pulsatility and resistance indexes are measures of vascular health. In obese individuals, these indexes can be altered due to the increased pressure and resistance in the blood vessels. Therefore, increased carotid artery pulsatility and resistance indexes can indeed be early signs of vascular abnormalities in young obese males.", "answer_choice": "A"}
